data.title: We Are Storm And Starlight by Sarah Delena White
data.meta_description: "If I could give this poetry collection 100 stars, I would still complain that there weren't enough." Review by Rayleigh Setser We are storm and starlightSpecter and sirenAnswer and question Experience this haunting anthology of poems about longing and heartbreak, grieving and new beginnings. This I hold as grace: love is not lostThere’s solace in…
data.text:
We are storm and starlight

Specter and siren

Answer and question

Experience this haunting anthology of poems about longing and heartbreak, grieving and new beginnings.

This I hold as grace: love is not lost

There’s solace in our meeting and our parting

I let you go and love you all the more

If I could give this poetry collection 100 stars, I would still complain that there weren't enough. This is truly the most beautiful poetry collection that I've read in a very long time, and I don't even know how I found it. I was just scrolling on my kindle, looking for something to read, and the title caught my eye. I am so, so glad that I decided to read it this evening. The flow and organization of the poems were artfully selected to take the reader on a journey of emotion. We start with adventurous poems about finding one's self-worth and identity, then sorrow in the challenges of finding love. Then our emotions are lifted again with romance and whistful thoughts only to be bashed with heartbreak. But I think what I loved the most is the tasteful end of mixing sorrow and joy together in a hopeful and beautiful conclusion. The entire collection is just incredibly well organized and I felt the transitions from poem to poem were so smoothly twined that it just flowed so perfectly. And the poems themselves?! My gracious. There wasn't a single one that I didn't want to highlight a line from. The mood and vibes of the poetry are like Autumn and Winter, lyrics and melodies, and Midnights by Taylor Swift. Here are a few of my favorite lines: "do not say I am a closed book when you only have to read me" "choose my winter; I will take your night" "love me like the fire beneath this flowering earth like the first flash of lightning on a summer night" All in all, I adored this poetry collection and I now want to go binge everything by this author that I can get my hands on. No content warning is necessary; romance is sweet and not spicy/explicit in any way. There is no cursing and no gore. Highly recommended to all poetry lovers.
